articles.title: About This Site
articles.contents: On this site you will find information about me, projects I have worked on, and ways to contact me.

            Summary
            My determination to protect and restore biodiversity began as I grew up on an Illinois State Land and Water Reserve and traveled to national parks, refuges, and wilderness areas. While visiting Glacier National Park in 2008, I witnessed Ken Burns and his crew filming his national park documentary. When I viewed the film the next year, I was determined to make it to every U.S. national park. In June of 2016, a small Cessna landed on the sand dunes of Kobuk Valley National Park and my goal was achieved.
            Earning a B.S. in Zoology and a B.S. in Geography and Environmental Resources from Southern Illinois University Carbondale laid the foundation to approach problems from both the perspective of societal needs and from the perspective of wildlife’s needs. Internships with The Nature Conservancy, the National Forest Foundation, Cypress Creek National Wildlife Refuge, and the National Great Rivers Research and Education Center enhanced skills in public education/outreach, collaboration, meeting facilitation, stewardship, and field methods. I am currently pursuing a Master of Environmental Science and Management degree at the University of California Santa Barbara Bren School, specializing in Conservation Planning.

articles.title: Resume
articles.contents:
Interests
I am keenly interested in working with private landowners to restore and conserve their land and, ultimately, envision myself working for a land trust.
In my free time, you will find me hiking, cooking, painting, visiting national parks, and spending as much time with my dog, Basil, as possible.
Education
University of California, Santa Barbara | Santa Barbara, CA
Master of Environmental Science and Management | September 2020 - June 2022
Southern Illinois University, Carbondale | Carbondale, IL
B.S. in Zoology & B.S. in Geography and Environmental Resources | August 2016 - May 2020
Experience & Projects
Conservation Connect Fellow | National Forest Foundation | May 2021 - May 2022
Designed a business plan for the Southern Idaho Forest Fund
Conducted meetings with U.S. Forest Service personnel
Compiled internal and external reports about southern Idaho National Forests shared with the Washington D.C. U.S. Forest Service office
Took notes during meetings
Created a direct mail postcard which was sent to residents of the Wood River Valley
Assisted in a media tour and community engagement event
Wrote a blog post
Floodplain Restoration GLOBE Intern | The Nature Conservancy | June 2019 - August 2019
Worked with the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service and Illinois Natural History Survey.
Conducted a public use survey and wrote a final summary report.
Created seamless stewardship data maps using ArcGIS and Collector.
